intro: Centaurea media, commonly known as the common centaury, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with narrow, grass-like leaves and bright blue or purple flowers. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, often found in meadows and along roadsides. Centaurea media is also known for its medicinal properties, having been used traditionally for its anti-inflammatory and astringent effects.
